content:
I have below suggestions for rephrasing the statement.

"""
The King is represented by K. The enemy piece is either Bishop (B), Knight (N), Rook (R) or Queen (Q). The empty positions are represented by {{_}}. There are only two pieces in the board: king and the enemy.
"""

It would have been better if we can replace "_" with "." in the input and remove whitespaces between the characters.

Can we remove "Knight" in this statement since the output is applicable for all types of enemies?

If a King is in any of those x positions relative to the Knight on the input diagram, then the answer is "Check", otherwise "No Check"

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: In the Diagram for the squares a Knight can attack, maybe you could separate the characters in the rows by spaces.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It is really nice for a puzzle

Submitted this as a Clash first (https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/63081cc5c45be5286c184fb63c7741842ad1) but got feedback that it was too hard to solve in 5 minutes in this form. Should still be an 'easy' puzzle, I believe. Might add a 'Medium' version where there are more than two enemy pieces if people are interested.
For the medium version, you could also ask for the possible fields the king can escape to or output Checkmate.

Hi, thanks for the approval.
I went to space-separate like you said, but then I realised it actually already is space-separated, the spaces just appear narrower in the description compared to the inputs.
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _
_ _ x _ x _ _ _
compared to:
________
__x_x___
Great! What if you put the diagram in a code environment? Those are probably typeset in a monospaced font and thus the spaces would show up more visibly, like in the example below.
